WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
The radical for foot and the kanji for foot are exactly the same.
That being said, there's also another meaning you should keep in mind, which is sufficient. If you think about it, one foot should be sufficient enough to walk around with if you hop.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Same kanjis and radicals make Jack a happy boy. You should also learn the other meaning as well, though, if you can.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What do you wear on your foot? You wear a sock (ãã).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Just think about your bare feet. Think about them too much. Feel how cold it is on your feet. Now, put on a sock to make it feel better. Ahhh, so nice!

humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " stop ", like the shape of the arm to the sole of the foot, the original meaning is the foot, which is the differentiated character of "ç–‹" (Ji Xusheng). See "ç–‹".

The inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty simplified the shape from the shin of the arm to the calf into an â—‹ shape. Because Oracle in the " positive " word from " imports " from the " stop ", and from â—‹ from " stop " to " foot " shape near, so many scholars ' positive ' word Oracle release is " enough ." See " positive ". Warring States " foot " Cheng Jinwen turned into the " mouth ", "from the dead " and " Cloth " word gradually differentiate. "Shuowen": "Foot is the foot of a person. Below. From the cessation and the mouth. All the feet are from the foot." Xu Shen also mentioned under "ç–‹": "Ancient prose thinks the "Poetry" is a big word. Think of it as a full character." This shows that there was an occasional mixing of " foot " and " suffocation " during the Warring States Period, but the two-character form was different at that time.

Oracle is used as the original meaning, referring to the foot, and also used as the name of the person. Bronze is pronounced " Xu ", which means auxiliary. For use cases, please refer to "ç–‹".

The Warring States word " foot " is used as the original meaning and refers to the foot. "Guodian Chu Jian. "Five Elements" Jane 45: "Ears, eyes, nose, mouth, hands, feet, the battle of the heart." And " foot " refers to enough, "Shangbo Bamboo Book One. Jane 11: "If the ministers are not close, the loyalty and respect are insufficient." This means that if the ministers are not close to the monarch, then their loyalty and respect will not be enough.

Meaning Mnemonic
The radical for foot and the kanji for foot are exactly the same.
That being said, there's also another meaning you should keep in mind, which is sufficient. If you think about it, one foot should be sufficient enough to walk around with if you hop.
Same kanjis and radicals make Jack a happy boy. You should also learn the other meaning as well, though, if you can.

What do you wear on your foot? You wear a sock (ãã).
